intro: Amphiglossa kolbei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Amphiglossa kolbei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
